question: ğŸ’¸ | Is the event free to attend?
answer: Yes! The event is completely free to attend! We'll even be providing food, drinks, and prizes!

question: ğŸ“ | Where is the event? Is it in person or virtual? Where can I park?
answer: The event is at Toronto Metropolitan University (TMU) campus in downtown Toronto! It'll be in-person, and TMU has plenty of parking available. More specifics will be disclosed closer to the hackathon.

question: ğŸ¤” | Who can attend TerraHacks?
answer: Terrahacks is open to any students, and welcomes all levels of experience! Attendees must be at least 18 years old.

question: ğŸ«‚ | What is the team size limit?
answer: You can have upto 4 people on one team. If you don't have a team, don't worry! We'll have a team formation session at the beginning of the event.

question: ğŸ˜´ | Do I need to stay overnight?
answer: Nope! Staying overnight is 100% optional. You're free to come and go as you please. We'll have a quiet areas setup for those who want to stay overnight.

question: ğŸ‘¾ | When can we start working on your project? Can I work on a project I've already started?
answer: You cannot start coding until after the opening ceremony. You're welcome to brainstorm some ideas beforehand, but you can't start coding until the event officially starts. You can't work on a project you've already started either

question: ğŸª© | What kind of activites will there be at TerraHacks?
answer: Detailed schedule will be released closer to the event, but you can expect mini-events, workshops, sponsored segments, and more!

question: ğŸ†˜ | How do I sign up as a volunteer?
answer: You can sign up using the application portal! We'll be in touch with you shortly after you apply.

question: ğŸ’» | What do I need to bring to TerraHacks?
answer: You'll need to bring your laptop, charger, and any other tech you need to work on your project. We also recommend bringing a change of clothes, toiletries, and a sleeping bag if you plan on staying overnight.

question: ğŸ“§ | I've still got questions!
answer: No worries! Just email us at contact@terrahacks.ca or join the discord community! We'll get back to you as soon as possible about any questions you may have.
